paper.title: Canonical Security Modeling for Federated Databases

author.org: Institute of Statistics & Computer Science, University of Vienna Liebigg. 4/3-4, A-1010 Vienna, Austria E-mail: guenther@ifs.univie.ac.at

paper.abstract: Abstract The paper proposes a discretionary and mandatory security policy as a canonical security model for FDBSs. Both access controls are requested by most national and international standardization and evaluation criteria for systems trying to get classified at the higher security classes. In the discussion included are security relevant concepts and techniques that may differ among component databases significantly. In our opinion a canonical security model must capture all of them. Main attention is given to fine-tune discretionary and mandatory protection for the special needs in a federated database environment.
